page.title: 07THE SUNDAY MARKET
page.content: The Sunday Market is held in the Longfield area from 2pm to 5pm. The traders erect stalls and display their goods but some sell from the back of vans. A large variety of items are sold and the salesmen shout out the prices in loud voices in order to attract the customers' attention. Some of the goods are not of a good quality but others such as spotlights and car engine parts are good value and bargains can be had. The pet stall is very popular with the children and goldfish and turtles can be bought cheaply. There are also hardware stalls, toy stalls and many clothes stalls which are owned by coloured people from India and Pakistan.
